definitions.text: the actors in a play
container into which liquid is poured to create a given shape when it hardens
the distinctive form in which a thing is made
examples: pottery of this cast was found throughout the region

definitions.text: the visual appearance of something or someone
examples: the delicate cast of his features

definitions.text: bandage consisting of a firm covering (often made of plaster of Paris) that immobilizes broken bones while they heal
object formed by a mold
the act of throwing dice
the act of throwing a fishing line out over the water by means of a rod and reel
a violent throw
put or send forth
examples: She threw the flashlight beam into the corner
The setting sun threw long shadows
cast a spell
cast a warm light

definitions.text: deposit
examples: cast a vote
cast a ballot

definitions.text: select to play,sing, or dance a part in a play, movie, musical, opera, or ballet
examples: He cast a young woman in the role of Desdemona

definitions.text: throw forcefully
assign the roles of (a movie or a play) to actors
examples: Who cast this beautiful movie?

definitions.text: move about aimlessly or without any destination, often in search of food or employment
examples: The gypsies roamed the woods
roving vagabonds
the wandering Jew
The cattle roam across the prairie
the laborers drift from one town to the next
They rolled from town to town

definitions.text: form by pouring (e.g., wax or hot metal) into a cast or mold
examples: cast a bronze sculpture

definitions.text: get rid of
examples: he shed his image as a pushy boss
shed your clothes

definitions.text: choose at random
examples: draw a card
cast lots

definitions.text: formulate in a particular style or language
examples: I wouldn't put it that way
She cast her request in very polite language

definitions.text: eject the contents of the stomach through the mouth
examples: After drinking too much, the students vomited
He purged continuously
The patient regurgitated the food we gave him last night
